      • applyServerImageToControl

        public void applyServerImageToControl(java.lang.Object object,
                                      java.lang.String fileName,
                                      java.lang.String sConfigName,
                                      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table tableControl,
                                      int columnIndex)
        Applies the image to the object after fetching it from the server as specified in the config file. The object sould be an instance of Label or a TableItem. This method uses a session level caching mechanism to minimise network usage. The caching mechanism involves:
        • Check for the presence of the image in the cache. If not found, fetch the image from the server. Save the fetched image to the disk (a disk cache) and add the fileName (key) to imgDiskCacheMap (done in YRCImageFecher).
        • Check the map imgDiskCache for presence of the image on the disk. The presence of the fileName with value true implies that the file exits an the disk cache. The false value indicates that the given fileName could not be fetched from the server and we need not fetch the image again.
        • Add the fileName-img as the key-value pair to the imgMemoryCache Map.
        • The cached image is then applied to the control.
        • If an error is encountered while fetching and saving the file, the key-value pair: fileName-false is added to imgDiskCache. When the same fileName is passed to fetch the image again, null is returned instead calling the server once again.

        On system exit, the cached images are disposed and the temporary directory is deleted.
        Parameters:
        object - The control on which the image is to be applied. In case of a table, it is the element associated with the table item. This has been done so in order to apply the image to the actual table item at the time image is being applied.
        fileName - : The relative path of the image URL to be fetched from the server.
        tableControl -

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: IYRCDisposable
        Method called post the application shutdown. By the time this method is invoked, all UI components and resources have been disposed off. Classes implementing the interface should free the resources if used and can perform post shut down operations in this method.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface IYRCDisposable
